@jim_milton@twtxt.net Easy! You have to provide the Username + Email you used in the ‚ÄúPassword Reset‚Äù form. If you forget your Email address, or no longer hav access to it, too bad, not possible to recover your account. In fact there is so little PII (none really) that there would be no way for me to prove that you own an account in the first place (or that you created it). üòÖ

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @prologic I didn't think too much of him previously; didn't dislike him any more than I dislike billionaires generally. He just seemed like a run of the mill rich guy con artist who happened to appeal to a certain type of tech guy. But, the other day he tweeted something about his first born child dying in his arms and how he felt the last heartbeat. But then his ex-wife tweeted that no, in fact the child had suffered from SIDS and died in her arms. And that soured me on him completely forever. He's the sort of self-important narcissist who would make up something about a dying baby to try to score points in an online argument. That's so pathetic and contemptible.

Anyway this a perfect example of what I see as ‚Äúinformation warfare‚Äù, who do you believe? Elon or his ex-wife?! ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Also why in da fuq would you use a child‚Äôs (short) life to prop yourself up?! ü§¨ I mean fuck c‚Äômon Elon, grow the fuck up, I‚Äôm a father of two young beautiful daughters, I can never, ever doing that kind of shit.

↳ In-reply-to ¬ª @prologic I didn't think too much of him previously; didn't dislike him any more than I dislike billionaires generally. He just seemed like a run of the mill rich guy con artist who happened to appeal to a certain type of tech guy. But, the other day he tweeted something about his first born child dying in his arms and how he felt the last heartbeat. But then his ex-wife tweeted that no, in fact the child had suffered from SIDS and died in her arms. And that soured me on him completely forever. He's the sort of self-important narcissist who would make up something about a dying baby to try to score points in an online argument. That's so pathetic and contemptible.

@abucci@anthony.buc.ci (forking this because I don‚Äôt want to talk about misinformation and/or covid, but more focus on what really bugs me about the state of things, ‚Äúinformation warfare‚Äù) ‚Äì This is just abhorrent (if true, obviously I believe you, but I have no interest in Twitter or following billionaires beyond word-of-mouth Yarns like this‚Ä¶) ‚Äì I agree with you üíØ and share a similar view, I also never thought much of Elon Musk either, initially had thoughts of ‚ÄúOh cool, this guy is building that and this and the other. Awesome!‚Äù ‚Äì But boi do things change‚Ä¶ Maybe its the love of money and power that‚Äôs gotten to his late of late? ü§î I dunno ü§î I‚Äôd love to have even a small fraction of that kind of money just to a) understand what its like and b) prove that you don‚Äôt have to be an asshole or a self-important narcissist (I hate this about ‚Äúpeople‚Äù that get into positions of ‚Äúpower‚Äù, such self-important BS)

i‚Äôll only say a couple of things here:

  • we seem to find ourselves in an age of @information war‚Äù
  • Elon Musk is a better than a centric idiot (I feel at times he should just shut the fuck up)
